strings.text:
Welcome to the Early Access of Blade & Sorcery!

Please take note that this game is a work in progress. A lot of features are still missing, balancing has some issues and bugs are expected.

For more information about the roadmap, to submit bugs, request a feature, participate to the development or to simply talk about the game, you can join the dedicated Discord using the links below.

Thank you for your interest about my game, 
and happy playing!

Cheer!                                       KospY
Sandbox is a free mode that lets you fight against wave of enemies of your choosing
Choose a destination on the map to travel

items.name: Quiver
items.description: Often made of leather, wood or fur, the quiver can hold 12 arrows

items.name: Armored buckler
items.description: The small size and maneuverability of the buckler make it valuable when dealing with light blades

items.name: Buckler
items.description: The small size and maneuverability of the buckler make it valuable when dealing with light blades

items.name: Shield
items.description: Small enough to carry but large enough to deflect arrows, the wooden shield provides a good all-around defense

items.name: Kite shield
items.description: Although cumbersome, the kite shield offers maximum protection against arrows and large blades

items.name: Round shield
items.description: Small enough to carry but large enough to deflect arrows, the wooden shield provides a good all-around defense

items.name: Arrow
items.description: Usually consisting of a long, fin-stabilized shaft and pointed tip, the arrow is a penetrating projectile used with a bow

items.name: Axe
items.description: Benefiting from the strength of its wielder, the axe is effective brutal hacking and chopping weapon

items.name: Bardiche
items.description: A descendant of the Dane axe, the cleaver style blade of the bardiche makes it suitable for hacking and slashing

items.name: Axe
items.description: Benefiting from the strength of its wielder, the axe is effective brutal hacking and chopping weapon

items.name: Bow
items.description: A staple of combat since ancient times, the bow is a lethal and effective long range weapon

items.name: Claymore
items.description: No description

items.name: Claymore
items.description: With its long blade and distinctive style of cross-hilt, the claymore was designed to wield with two hands

items.name: Dagger
items.description: A favourite of rogues, the sharp tip of the dagger makes it primarily a stabbing and thrusting weapon

items.name: Common Dagger
items.description: A common dagger, found on any footmen... dead or alive.

items.name: Dane Axe
items.description: The relatively light and thin blade of the Dane axe gives it a devastating cutting ability while keeping enemies at polearm length

items.name: Dual blade staff
items.description: This unorthodox weapon can be wielded with one hand of two, with two bladed ends posing maximum threat

items.name: Bardiche
items.description: A descendant of the Dane axe, the cleaver style blade of the bardiche makes it suitable for hacking and slashing

items.name: Longsword
items.description: Characterized by a long grip and cruciform hilt, the longsword is most effective when wielded with two hands

items.name: Trench mace
items.description: Crude but effective, the club can be used to stun and batter opponents, knocking them out of the fight

items.name: Trench mace
items.description: Crude but effective, the club can be used to stun and batter opponents, knocking them out of the fight

items.name: Maul
items.description: With its weight and size, the maul can crush through armor and bones alike

items.name: Rapier
items.description: A long, slender blade with a razor sharp tip makes the rapier optimized to be a thrusting and stabbing weapon

items.name: Antique Sword
items.description: The sword of a forgotten king

items.name: Short Sword
items.description: The perfect match for one handed combat

items.name: Spear
items.description: Wielded with either one hand or two, the thrust of a spear can keep distance between you and your enemy

items.name: Boar Spear
items.description: Some folk say that once, a drunk king died because he didn't used this one.

items.name: Staff
items.description: Although primarily ornamental and a symbol of status, the staff can nonetheless be used as a crude club if needed

items.name: Broadsword
items.description: The sharp edges and pointed tip make the broadsword a versatile offensive weapon

items.name: Falchion
items.description: The iconic curve of the falchion makes it ideal for hack and slash, but the sharp tip also allows for stabbing

items.name: Wrist blade
items.description: No description

pages.text:
If you are new to VR or not used to smooth locomotion, it's recommended to do short game session first to avoid motion sickness. 
For the majority of players, motion sickness progressivly disappear overtime to the point that it should not be a problem anymore.

The "lag" or "delay" while moving your weapon are done on purpose to give a feeling of weight and to allow physic based interactions. 
Practice different weapons and adjust your speed relative to them. After some time it will feel natural and you should not even notice it anymore.
Some weapons will require you to handle them with both hands to move them effectively.

You can sheath up to 4 objects/weapons on you by dropping them over your left or right shoulder or on each side of your hips. 
You can practice doing it by looking at yourself in the mirror in the home.
Be aware that some objects are restricted to hips or back only.
All grabbed objects use physics so you can't move them through obstacles, stuck objects will be automatically dropped if your hand goes too far (can be changed in the options).

You can hold some objects at different positions or rotations along the handle. If the hand position does not suit you, just grab it elsewhere or use the trigger button to slide your hand along the handle.
Daggers, axes and spears can be used as ranged weapons. Practice throwing them using slow motion as you will get better force and precision as a result.
Piercing weapons such as daggers, axes, spears and arrows can be used to penetrate flesh or wood.
To select a spell, press the corresponding controller button (see inputs in the menu) then move your hand over one of the orbs and release.
Your remaining health and mana can be checked by looking at your wrist.
Potions can be used to restore your health.
Slowing time gives you more force.
To grab an equipped quiver, press the trigger while hovering on it and grab (with the grip button)
For more information about inputs, open the menu by pressing Y and go to the "controller inputs" section
For more information about inputs, open the menu by pressing left menu button while pressing touchpad center and go to the "controller inputs" section
For more information about inputs, open the menu by pressing the left menu button and go to the "controller inputs" section
For more information about inputs, open the menu by pressing B and go to the "controller inputs" section
For more information about inputs, open the menu by pressing Y and go to the "controller inputs" section
